intro: Odontarrhena pugiostyla, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of East Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of yellow and orange. Its leaves are broad and heart-shaped, often covered in a fine layer of hair. Odontarrhena pugiostyla thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas at high altitudes.
